  • Interest in machine learning—any exposure to scikit‑learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch is a plus.

Preferred (Nice-to-Have)

What You’ll Gain

  • Hands‑on experience at the intersection of geophysics, fiber‑optic sensing, and AI.

job_description:
Technical Lead – Linux Administration

Location: Hybrid Employment Type: Full-Time Experience Required: 7+ years (or less with equivalent skill set)

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Technical Lead (Linux Administration) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in Linux server administration, virtualization platforms, networking fundamentals, and system troubleshooting. This role involves leading technical initiatives, supporting infrastructure, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless operations.

Key Responsibilities

Linux Administration - Install, configure, and maintain all major Linux distributions (Debian, Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL, Fedora, SUSE, Arch). - Manage partitioning, file systems (ext4, XFS, Btrfs, ZFS), and package management tools (APT, YUM/DNF, Zypper, Pacman). - Handle system initialization using systemd and init.d.

User & Permission Management - Manage users, groups, and sudoers access. - Configure file ownership, ACLs, and security frameworks such as SELinux and AppArmor.

Virtualization & Hosting - Install, configure, and manage Proxmox VE. - Create, manage, and monitor KVM virtual machines & LXC containers. - Implement backup and restore strategies within Proxmox. - Integrate networking and storage solutions (Ceph, ZFS, NFS, iSCSI). - Provide support for WHMCS-based help desk solutions.

Networking Fundamentals - Administer and troubleshoot TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, NAT, VLANs, and VPNs. - Manage IP addressing, subnetting, and routing. - Configure and maintain firewalls (iptables, nftables, firewalld, ufw). - Conduct network diagnostics using tools like ping, traceroute, netstat, ss, tcpdump, and nmap.

Content Delivery Networks (CDN) - Understand CDN concepts and work with CDN providers. - Integrate websites/services with CDN and configure DNS for CDN usage.

Troubleshooting & Maintenance - Resolve OS-level issues including boot/GRUB problems, service failures, and resource bottlenecks. - Analyze logs (/var/log, rsyslog, journald) and diagnose hardware issues (SMART monitoring, RAID, NIC failures, memory/CPU diagnostics). - Use remote management tools (iLO, iDRAC, IPMI). - Coordinate with onsite teams for cabling, hardware replacements, and device setup; manage escalation procedures and maintain documentation.

Monitoring & Security - Implement and maintain monitoring tools (Nagios, Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana). - Harden servers by configuring firewalls, securing SSH, and applying timely patches.

Qualifications & Skills

  • 7+ years of Linux Administration experience (or equivalent skill set).
  • Strong knowledge of virtualization platforms (Proxmox, KVM, LXC).
  • Solid understanding of networking, firewalls, and CDN integration.
  • Proven experience in troubleshooting at OS and hardware levels.
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools and security best practices.
  • Excellent communication and coordination skills for working with onsite teams.

Preferred Attributes

  • Certification(s) in Linux Administration, Networking, or Virtualization (RHCE, LFCS, CompTIA Linux+, etc.).
  • Hands-on experience with WHMCS or similar help desk systems.
  • Ability to document processes and create clear technical instructions.

Contact Information: Interested candidates, please share your resume at careers@hashroot.com. If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@hashroot.com.
summary: Seeking a Technical Lead with 7+ years in Linux Administration, strong virtualization, and networking skills. Role involves leading initiatives, infrastructure support, and cross-functional collaboration.

About Techversant:

Techversant is a Global Technology Services and Solutions Company with over 16 years of experience, providing high-quality end-to-end IT solutions and services worldwide. We specialize in Digital Transformation, understanding evolving industrial scenarios, investment priorities, and technology disruptions. Our expertise spans multiple technology domains, including ColdFusion, Python, Java, .NET, NodeJS, Ruby on Rails, Golang, PHP, Angular, ReactJS, VueJS, IOS, Android, Flutter, ReactNative, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Blockchain, and Business Intelligence.

About the Role:

Techversant is seeking an experienced Solution Architect to design and implement scalable, high-performance AI-driven applications utilizing the latest technologies in Python, cloud, and machine learning. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in Python development, excellent leadership capabilities, and a passion for mentoring and guiding team members.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Architect and design end-to-end solutions using Python (Django/FastAPI/Flask), AI/ML models, and cloud-native technologies.
  • Lead AI/ML-driven application development, including model deployment, data pipelines, and intelligent automation.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate AI/ML models into scalable applications.
  • Optimize system performance, ensuring scalability, cost efficiency, and security.
  • Implement microservices architecture with APIs, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and event-driven design.
  • Drive best DevOps practices with CI/CD pipelines, MLOps, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation), and automated testing.

Preferred Skills:

  • Python & Full Stack: Django, FastAPI, Flask, React, Angular, or Vue.js.
  • AI/ML & Data Science: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, NLP, Computer Vision, or MLOps.
  • Cloud & DevOps: AWS, Azure, or GCP with Kubernetes & CI/CD.
  • Big Data & Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Snowflake, or Spark.
  • Architecture & Security: Microservices, API Gateway, Event-Driven Systems, and best security practices.

Ideal Experience Level:

  • 10+ years in software development with strong Python expertise, including full-stack development.
  • 2+ years of experience as a Solution Architect, with demonstrated success in leading and delivering enterprise-level projects.
  • Strong AI/ML experience, specifically in model deployment, data engineering, and cloud integration.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Hands-on experience with LLMs, Generative AI, or Reinforcement Learning.
  • Expertise in GraphQL, Serverless (AWS Lambda, Firebase), and Edge AI.
  • Experience with data engineering, real-time analytics, and feature stores.

What Company Offers:

  • Excellent career growth opportunities and exposure to multiple technologies.
  • Fixed weekday day schedule with weekends off.
  • Family Medical Insurance.
  • Unique leave benefits and encashment options based on performance.
  • Long-term growth opportunities.
  • Fun family environment surrounded by experienced developers.
  • Various internal employee rewards programs based on performance.
  • Opportunities for various other bonus programs (training hours, certifications, innovation).
  • Work-life balance with flexible work timings, early out Fridays, and social/cultural activities.
  • Company-sponsored international tours.
summary: Seeking an experienced Python Solution Architect to design scalable AI-driven applications using Python, cloud, and ML. Must have strong leadership and Python development background.

job_description:
L2 Application Support Engineer - Remote

Company: Orisysindia Consultancy Services (P) Ltd Location: Remote Experience: 3-6 years Employment Type: Full-time Immediate Joining Preferred Work Time: 8:00 PM to 4:00 AM IST

Contact Email: recruitment@orisys.in Website: http://www.orisys.in Closing Date: October 7, 2025 Job Published: September 30, 2025

About the Role

We are seeking a proactive and technically skilled L2 Application Support Engineer to provide first-level support for business-critical applications. The role involves handling end-user queries, reproducing and validating issues in test environments, and collaborating with the Development and QA teams to ensure timely resolution. The candidate will also be responsible for keeping end users updated on the status of their tickets via communication channels such as Slack.

This role does not require on-call support; all communications and updates will be managed through defined collaboration channels.

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the first point of contact for application-related queries and technical issues raised by end users.
  • Provide technical troubleshooting and solutions within agreed SLAs.
  • Reproduce and validate issues in a test environment before escalating to L2/Development teams.
  • Accurately assess whether reported issues are defects or change requests, and where possible, suggest workarounds.
  • Document issues, resolutions, and root cause analysis for knowledge base purposes.
  • Collaborate closely with QA/Testers and Developers for issue triage and resolution.
  • Manage communication with end users (e.g., via Slack) to keep them informed of ticket status and progress.
  • Escalate critical incidents appropriately to ensure timely resolution.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Hands-on experience in application/technical support (not just customer support).
  • Strong testing capability: analytical thinking, quick product learning, and ability to reproduce client-reported issues.
  • Ability to differentiate between defects and changes, and guide users with possible workarounds.
  • Experience with ticketing systems (e.g., JIRA, ServiceNow, Zendesk).
  • Exposure to QA/Testing practices or background as a Tester is highly desirable.
  • Good communication skills to effectively interact with end users and internal teams.
  • Basic knowledge of databases (SQL) and ability to run queries for issue analysis is an advantage.
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools and incident management practices is a plus.

Ideal Candidate Profile

  • Background in Testing or Development with exposure to application support.
  • Strong customer-facing skills, combined with technical depth to handle L1 support independently.
  • Analytical, detail-oriented, and able to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
summary: Seeking an L2 Application Support Engineer for remote, full-time work. Responsibilities include troubleshooting, issue resolution, and user communication via Slack, with immediate joining preferred.

job_description:
Senior Full-Stack Engineer (API Platform)

Company: HybCloud Technologies (P) Ltd (Cloud Control) Location: ACE-12, 4th Floor, C-DAC Building, Technopark, Trivandrum, Kerala, India, 695582 Website: http://www.ecloudcontrol.com Job Published: 30, Sept 2025 Closing Date: 22, Oct 2025 Contact Email: asprasad@ecloudcontrol.com

Brief Description

We are building a next-generation API management platform for developers and administrators. Our platform focuses on high performance, real-time validation, and intelligent tooling for onboarding, editing, and governing APIs.

Role Overview

As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for the end-to-end development of our editor hub, dashboard, and supporting backend services. This role requires delivering a responsive, scalable, and maintainable product while collaborating with product, design, and infrastructure teams. You will have a significant influence on architecture, state management strategy, and modular component design.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and evolve a React + TypeScript front-end for an editor-centric enterprise application.
  • Integrate Monaco Editor for real-time contract editing (OpenAPI specs) with features like syntax highlighting, validation, and error reporting (e.g., via Spectral).
  • Manage application state using lightweight frameworks such as Zustand or Recoil, avoiding unnecessary Redux complexity.
  • Build Fastify-based Node.js backend services to support API validation, schema management, session/lock handling, and integrations.
  • Model, query, and operate on data using MongoDB (including schema design, aggregation pipelines, transactions, and indexing).
  • Write unit tests using Jest and end-to-end tests using Playwright.
  • Develop a responsive, theme-able UI using Tailwind CSS, design tokens, and a component-driven architecture.
  • Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers to transform wireframes and mocks into polished, user-friendly interfaces (dashboards, side panels, widgets).
  • Prioritize performance, scalability, and clean architecture across all modules and features.
  • Identify and refactor technical debt, and mentor more junior engineers.
  • Participate actively in code reviews, design discussions, and planning sessions.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Strong experience with React + TypeScript (hooks, context, component composition, patterns).
  • Solid Node.js skills; experience with Fastify is preferred (Express is acceptable).
  • Experience with state management solutions other than Redux (e.g., Zustand, Recoil, Jotai).
  • Deep understanding of MongoDB (schema modeling, queries, transactions, indexing, performance tuning).
  • Proficiency with Tailwind CSS, utility-first styling, responsive design, and theming.
  • Proven experience writing unit tests and E2E tests (Jest, Playwright, or equivalent).
  • Solid grasp of REST APIs, concurrency, locking/session management, and distributed systems fundamentals.
  • Familiarity with Docker for containerization and some exposure to Kubernetes or orchestration.
  • Strong software architecture sense, modular design, clean code practices, and the ability to reason about scaling.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience integrating Monaco Editor or building web-based IDE / contract editors.
  • Knowledge of Azure Key Vault, Azure API Management (APIM), or API lifecycle tools.
  • Experience in CI/CD pipelines, automated deployments, and cloud-native architectures.
  • Past work on collaborative or multi-user real-time applications (CRDTs, OT, conflict resolution).
  • Familiarity with distributed locks, Redis, or similar concurrency tooling.
summary: Senior Full-Stack Engineer to build a next-gen API management platform. Responsibilities include developing React/TypeScript front-end, Node.js backend, and MongoDB integration. Requires strong API, scaling, and testing experience.
